Reviews.Title: “Mistake”
Reviews.Author: Nickie F
Reviews.Content: This hotel was more like a prison although prisoners would have better treatment and don't have to pay £45. I stayed in room 35 both windows were closed and still the noise from the traffic was way to loud. the curtains were hanging off the wall. The bed was broke in the middle. When i was looking in the mirror i notice stains all over the wall. The shared bathroom was disgusting the shower was just a curtain next to the toilet with no hot water. Old fashioned phones that don't work.

Reviews.Title: “My staying at Gresham”
Reviews.Author: Elisa S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I apprexiated the location very much: nice, quiet and restful, and above all well connected with any site by tube or bus. Rooms are very small and simple, but nice and clean. Service is good, the staff is kind and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Monty Python still lives!!”
Reviews.Author: Duck57_8 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We never used the restaurant so would have no idea as to the quality of the food. Our room was very small but adequate for our needs. We decided to have a drink in the 'bar' before the arrival of our taxi. Big mistake. They have no idea how to run a bar. My wife ordered a vodca with lime cordial and ice. They had never heard of lime cordial and hasd no ice. We changed the order to vodca and orange, they had no orange - it goes on but haven't the space. I ordered a Grouse whiskey the blank look on the guys face said it all. Our advice, don't bother and find a pub, there are plenty around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Erika L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was perfect!!!!Very nice and helpful staff.The room was okey but the beds were terrible!They were so hard so it was hard to sleep, but we asked for extra blankets so then it was better.The breakfast was ok for that price!

Reviews.Title: “Hice hotel with really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Valentin D Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice, with perfect location (Paddington Station is just 5 min by walk) and amazingly helpful staff. Room was warm and there was hot water all the time. The only thing you need to pay aatention is that the rooms on the lower floor are a little noisy between 8 am and 10 am as thay are very close to breakfast place. But this will be an issue only if you plan to sleep till lunch time. After 10 pm the whole hotel is very quiet. I will definitely come again as the price and the comfort are in very good correlation, especially for London.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We have no complaints We only stayed for one night but the room was well equipped, a comfortable bed and clean the only negative is the room is quite small. It is also in a good location for the tube/trains.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Elaine W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only 5 mins away from Paddington train station and tube station. It got everything i need nearby, e.g tesco supermarket, places for breakfast & dinner, corner shops, etc. The room is a bit small but i am fine with it coz i am paying only 30 pounds for a twin bedroom per night!

Reviews.Title: “First time in London”
Reviews.Author: Rama S
Reviews.Content: Perfect for our purposes(4 friends one big room)--close to Paddington rail station and tube stops; friendly, accommodating staff; nice room with refrigerator, clean bathroom, good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: WanFarhan
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stay here in jan 2012 during my visit to london. Frankly, great location. Lots of food stall surrounding, big bus route, very nice neighbourhood, clean and good hospitality. I will come and stay here again :) WanFarhan & Wife Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.

Reviews.Title: “Only just adequate for a few hours!”
Reviews.Author: vernthetern
Reviews.Content: Luckily we only needed a few hours for shower and sleep before moving on to Paddington station and Heathrow airport. Only a short walk from this hotel to Paddington station and the Heathrow trains. It's a shabby hotel. Everything worn out. Our room - broken toilet seat, broken light fitting hanging down, torn bed cover, TV didn't work. Tiny room next to the ancient lift. However, good hot water, comfortable bed and friendly receptionist. Had no time for breakfast but dread to think about what would be on offer! Best advice is to only use this hotel for a minimum of 1 night and pay as little as possible.

Reviews.Title: “what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: emckellar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the 2nd time, and both times have expected much worse than I received. Receptionists don't speak perfect english, and can't always help with technical difficulties (remote for tv wasn't working so receptionist just tried to give us different sets of batteries), but to be fair there doesnt seem to be any more than 3 or 4 of them and reception is open 24 hour. The hotel has what can only be described as a troop of cleaners, during cleaning time (around 10am onwards) we must have passed about 8 cleaners, all doing a very thorough job. The rooms are small, yes, however if you're going to London to stay in your hotel constantly you'd be better off in the Hilton round the corner. This is a good base for a long weekend in London (probably wouldnt stay longer than 4 nights), a good place to sleep, shower and set off from. On my first visit, stayed in the basement room under the stairs, second stay was in room 234 on the 3rd floor. Both have their flaws but for £40 odd a night round the corner from one of the main stations in london on all the tube lines, really you shouldn't be complaining.

Reviews.Title: “christmas break for one”
Reviews.Author: davejb b
Reviews.Content: if you have an option, dont take this please! on arrival charged 5% extra for paying by card wasn't shown to room and why? because it was so small and dingy it was unbelievable.. room was warm but so warm it needed window open but then so noisy from street noise i couldn't sleep. Room was tiny, if your over 5"6 dont bother, trust me!! do not have breakfast! For your health dont do it! i was 1st to breakfast yesterday 27th dec 2011, the bread that was laid out for toast was not only stale some of it was mouldy! This was at 7:35, someone could have gone to shop round corner!! its scandalous but breakfast costs more on top. lease dont do it! 7;45 someone did go to shop and returned thru dining area with 2 loves of bread, but these fresh loaves never made it to dining area. I paid £5 for an opaque rasher of bacon, a cold sausage and an egg that had never seen a chickens bottom. never again yet come come olympic year 2012 , they will cream it in, and that is shocking, not only for the federation of inn keepers and hoteliers, but for us as a nation to allow such filth.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever in London”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: On arrival tried to charge extra for paying by card which is ridiculous. After I returned from the cashpoint and paid I was shown to a tiny room with a 14 inch TV and a small wardrobe. This takes up 90% of the room space. To use the kettle you need to place it on the floor next to the socket. the shower room is also tiny. You can hear everything going on outside the room as if there were no door or walls. The elevator hardly works at all. They charge £5 extra for breakfast. Don't bother. As said...this is the worst value for money hotel in London. Even at £50 a night this place would be overpriced. Do not stay in this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: fionaf676
Reviews.Content: had booked a double room for the weekend and when we arrived the told us they were full and could not find our booking despite having our booking form and deposit paid.the receptionist was not one bit helpful or friendly.we were left to our own devices in looking for another hotel after arriving from ireland and not knowing our way round.i would advice people to stay clear of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hmmm read my review”
Reviews.Author: ridetheroad
Reviews.Content: got to hotel had to pay 15.00 pounds to park rooms too small for funiture cramped needs ugrading very stuffy at night no air shower room small bed uncomfortable tossed and turned goz of springs sticky threw terrible wouldnt stay there again i wouldnt rate this hotel at all its only a two star in my eyes bad for the money i paid

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean”
Reviews.Author: kobiye
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Gresham for 6 nights with my sister as tourists, mostly just for shower and sleep. We took the twin room. All in all it was good value for money and pretty satisfactory. Pros ------ location (few minute walk from Paddington station, good options for quick breakfast in the nearby London-street). clean room / bathroom. Wi-Fi is free. price. Cons ------- Small room. Our twin-bed room was in fact like a double room, cause there was no extra space to keep between the beds. Access to the room was not so friendly; we had to use stairs. Service was so-so. If you're a light sleeper, you could be disturbed by some noise (we experienced it for 1 night or maybe 2), and not-great a mattress. I could count a few more cons with no great difficulty, but I don't see the reason to. This is a good place for people who seek value-for-money; a decent place to sleep and shower. By the way, I don't know the quality of the breakfast, but there's absolutely no reason to order it; there are plenty of places in the nearby London street. Mimo's being my warm recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: 685Tess
Reviews.Content: I was unfortunate enough to be travelling alone on business and stayed at this hotel. I was put up in the basement in a single room which was a bit like a prison cell. Why? Well it was windowless, the window faced into the downstairs lobby, so blinds had to be drawn, and it couldnt be opened. It was boiling hot in there! They had put a plastic sheet on the mattress protector, which made bed time even hotter. There was a noisy fan. The shower cubicle was tiny and one glass panel was missing, with a replacement curtain, which did not reach the bottom, water all over! The water from the shower came out of ceiling as well as shower head, which was novel. Sticky carpet in bedroom, and tv/ internet did not work. Avoid!!!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: jtop2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in august 2011, for a week. We had a triple room. The room size was small compared to purpose built hotels but it was sufficient. We were up early in morning and when we did come back to hotel we were shattered with sore feet. The location near paddington was great. We found the room clean at all times and the staff courteous. For somewhere at this price and centrally located it is perfect

Reviews.Title: “Great for MONEY but thats it”
Reviews.Author: Abbott1710
Reviews.Content: If your after a cheap n cheerful night then its great .. Receptionist wasnt that helpful and at times she was slightly rude .. Once we got our key to our room everything was fine, bath was rather dated but for £45 a night it was what you expected.. Its in a great location near train stations .. so u can get to most places with out any problems.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Pau109
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in early August having paid a mere £45 for the night. This is clearly a great price for a central London hotel, however you do get what you pay for. Our welcome at reception was fairly curt and at times quite rude. The receptionist seemed like he wanted to be elsewhere and who could blame him. It was a very hot muggy day and the hotel has no air conditioning whatsoever. It was absolutely baking throughout and opening the windows did nothing to lower the temperature. Our organiser was overcharged £50 and the receptionist was simply not interested in correcting his error. The rooms were tiny. Mine had a single bed with a plastic coated mattress covered in a sheet which had blood marks on it!. There was a small wardrobe and a TV with free view channels. The shower cubicle was small with weak water pressure and the toilet was so close to the sink you could barely move. There were also a couple of towels that seemed as though they had not been washed, one was still on the floor! Despite this for £45, I couldn't grumble. What annoyed me most was the heat in the room. Other rooms I saw had wet carpets and shower heads held on with sticky plasters! On the whole, I thought the hotel seemed quite dirty. We did not try breakfast as there are some great cafes just around the corner, nor did we use the bar for the same reason. This hotel is in a great location for Paddington Station and all other central London amenities. However I would recommend paying a little more and going for something more upmarket. If however you are on a budget then this hotel may suit.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: mafaldaUk
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very much like other hotels in the same street, but this one seem the best value for money. The price was reasonable, the rooms were extremely clean, free wi-fi and the location is great if you are going in/out of Paddington Station. On the last day, they had a problem with the wi-fi that got to our rooms. The person at the desk was very nice but couldn't help us (he said we needed to wait until Monday, for the IT person to come). Still, we could use the wi-fi at the reception, where they have a bar and various sofas, and he offered us tea or coffee at no extra charge. It was quite comfortable and he was very nice so I didn't mind.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel located in great location”
Reviews.Author: missaelle
Reviews.Content: 2 min walk from Paddington station which has direct trains to Gatwick and to central London attractions (take the Bakerloo line as it comes much more often than the District line) and short walk to the beautiful Hyde Park. Service was hit and miss - had a very nice young lady check us in but also talked to other staff members who seemed like they did not care and were too busy to talk to you. Room was quite small but was pretty clean. Bed was comfortable and linens were clean. Bathroom was large and shower/tub was good. Overall, the hotel is quite old and dated. There is no AC so you had to keep the windows open all day and night and the wind would be constantly blowing against the window shades causing a banging noise all night, which was sort of frustrating. There was an in-room safe but when we asked for the key they could not find it in the large and unorganized box of safe keys that they had at the front desk. We were told that we could keep valuables in the safe downstairs but we had read previous reviews about being weary of paying with credit cards etc., so we felt it was probably safer to just carry our valuables with us. Internet was horrifyingly slow, as were the lifts! It is definitely a very basic, no frills hotel but the price is very good (found on a cheap hotel booking site) and the location is great so we would probably stay here again if we could get it at the same low rate.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked - transferred to inferior B&B”
Reviews.Author: MWSwansea
Reviews.Content: I was booked into a single room via Expedia for one night. Upon arrival I was told that I had been transferred to another hotel - the Normandie, a few doors along. Given it was only a single night I didn't protest (or ask for any refund) but be warned - booked here doesn't necessarily mean that you'll get a room.

Reviews.Title: “Basic - close to paddington station”
Reviews.Author: V8V
Reviews.Content: This hotel met our needs and , for the price paid, met our needs. It is close enough to Paddington station to haul your luggage. Paddington has a regular (every 15 min) train to Heathrow (jurney time 15 min). If you want more than basic accomodation you will need to go elsewhere and pay more

Reviews.Title: “Don't give them your credit card!”
Reviews.Author: Guest186273
Reviews.Content: Other reviews have already summed up the: - tiny, and i mean tiny, rooms - thin walls, so neighbours keep you awake - noisy laminate floors, so footsteps keep you awake - tube train noise which may also, um...keep you awake - small, old tv with broken remote and bad reception - one internal window onto a very public corridor - kettle which didn't fit under tap to fill it - lead for the kettle which did not reach the plug socket..unless i put the kettle on the floor to boil it - only given powdered milk anyway - oh...and stale biscuits BUT add to that: - the bill was triple what it should have been - they announced they took it all off my card at book in even though i had specifically confirmed they would not - they said that (despite it being 'check out' time) no one was there who could discuss the dispute with me - i was told to pop in later that afternoon when the Manager would be back (tricky for travellers to do) - when i called to speak to the Manager at the time he 'would be in' he was not in - nor was he in each time i called thereafter. Not what you want from a mini-break.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: boltonad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great position. From here we walked to Hyde Park, Oxford Street, Regent Street, Covent Garden, Piccadilly Circus and more!. Paddington tube station, and bus stops are just around the corner for when you are not feeling so energetic! The reception staff are friendly and helpful. The room was clean and very small but big enough for a couple of nights. We booked room only, but you could have breakfast for £5 per person. We had this one morning it was an OK breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: SunyCapetown
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location, very central and close to shopping and food stores. My room was clean and good shower, I ll stay here again. On tip is to catch bus 27 or 205 to go to Camden market as its faster than metro and will take 20-30minutes at the most.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location at Great Price not for those whbout o likes the lifes luxeries!!”
Reviews.Author: Happyshopaholic
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just got back from a wkend break in London, we had tickets for the Legally Blonde Musical and wanted a central hotel that didn't break the bank. We found this hotel via Booking.com and after reading the reviews/location and seeing as the cost was only £60 thought it was worth the risk. We went straight to the hotel when we arrived in London and was very happy with the location, it was about 5 mins walk from Tottenham court road tube, we were told we couldn't check in until 3om but they would gladly store our luggage. When we returned we were asked if we wanted a room with an en-suite for an extra ten pounds and also if we wanted to see the room before paying. The room was as I expected, old and worn but clean nonetheless therefore we paid and settled in. This hotel is a bargain if your looking for a central hotel that doesn't cost a packet, if your looking to spend a bit of time in your hotel then I wouldn't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap basic accommodation without any frills”
Reviews.Author: Brettdad
Reviews.Content: We were given the name of this hotel by our travel agent. Our number one priority was ease of travel from Heathrow. After flying for 24hrs we wanted a reasonably cheap place to stay and wanted to drop our bags early so we could race into central London and soak up some sights. Being just around the corner from Paddington station and with Buses on Edgware Rd this looked like a good position for us. Now if your after quality and grandeur then look no further, it isn’t here! But if you do want an easy transit from the airport to Paddington then this is a hotel for you. The rooms were small but basically functional. The small bathroom had a toilet, sink and shower. Our biggest frustration was that the kettle needed to be boiled on the floor as there was no power point at the correct height. We had two rooms on the top floor. One room faced the road, Sussex Gardens, the other faced the rear, overlooking a large non descript courtyard. Noise was not a problem but then you are in a major city so don’t expect total peace and quiet. There was a lift but it was very small and required two trips for our party of four with our luggage. Don’t attempt to eat in or stay in your room for longer than it takes for the four S’s. (Sleep, Shower, Shave & Sh**). We had a great full English breakfast on our final morning in a little café on London St just around the corner. Very reasonably priced. There were lots of other eateries around the area with a supermarket and fruit and veg stores also just around the corner on Edgware Rd.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped”
Reviews.Author: Tonys31 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Awful stay at this hotel, was put in a tiny room on ground floor at the end of tiny corridor. Felt like a stock room that they'd thrown a bed in to squeeze extra guests in! Door to my room had a window cover by a blind/curtain, so let in loads of light and did not feel private. Tv did not work well was stuck on one channel. Would pay a little extra and stay somewhere half decent next time!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location n value for money”
Reviews.Author: keza12782
Reviews.Content: Ideal location bout 10 minute walk to all the the theatres soho west end good value for money if ur on a budget, room very dated in decor and basic but ideal for what we needed it was tidy staff were nice n helpful hotel has a lot of potential with a bit of tlc new decor could bring a lot punters in ,for what we paid and how close it was to everything was ideal and great value for money if ur looking for luxury n modern gresham not for u but if its a few nights to sleep fantastic can hear abit of the night life but to be expected in the centre of london. Very lively place great nights out pubs clubs theatres n much more all in walking distance ,if driving locate a car park near bye as we had a bit of trouble finding a car park when arriving there are lots but we got lost in the one way system tryin to find one as we were not familiar with the area once we had found one and had a walk round there were plenty to choose from prices vary the cheapest we found was 18 pound over night but there were others that where 36 pound over night so do ur research before you go would also recommend going to see the jersey boys show at the prince edward theatre was fantastic a real good story about frankie vallie and the four seasons Jersey boys fans

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness not the best”
Reviews.Author: Emmlou1
Reviews.Content: First impression was how small the hotel was and once we got into our room that was confirmed. You could barely get round the bed that was pushed up against the radiator in front of the window. The bed cover was heavily stained and the bathroom (that only one person could fit in) stunk of damp/mould. The shower tray filled up so quickly when using the shower that you couldn't spend long in there in fear that it would over flow onto the bathroom floor. There was definitely a drainage issue at this hotel. The hotel was also noisey, you could hear from the rooms above and the rooms next door. The service was very bland and not at all welcoming. I wouldn't book to stay here again, although the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “As long you dont expect quality sleep r quality service......”
Reviews.Author: ChristoffelB
Reviews.Content: To give a quick summary on the two main points: 1.The room was a big disappointment in qualty and service with the tv and tea making facilities not working and when we asked if they could address this while we went out we were told there was only one member of staff present and nothing could be done until the following day even though it was only 6pm at this stage. When we pointed out this was no acceptable the receptionist basically said tough if you have an issue speak to the management and turned his back on us. 2. Following our meal we returned to the room which was in the basement and did not sleep a wink due to the noise from the wooden floors above and nearby tube.

Reviews.Title: “NO ROOM AVAILABLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: LCM85
Reviews.Content: Made the booking and paid for the room to find out when I arrived at the hotel on the day of my stay there they had rejected my reservation and there were NO available rooms for us to stay. They had all my contact details and no one bothered to contact me to advice me that there were no more vacancies and I would have to find somewhere else. The staff were not very helpful and my partner had to run up and down the nearly streets to find a hotel with vacancies!!! Very disappointed and fuming that they took my money for a room that wasn't there. I wouldn't recommend to anyone. Oh and when I asked the hotel if this sort of thing happens often they said yes it happens quite frequently!

Reviews.Title: “The room is small, bath room very small but neat and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Nature317098
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a day only. Walkable distance from Paddington station. The room, bed and bath rooms were very neat and clean. Bath room is very small. Suitable only for small structured people. Hotel staff are very courteous. There is a shelf for keeping the luggage for a short period before check in or after check out. Suitable for short stay. Good value for the money paid.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel and very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Finnish91
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel from 7th to 11th June. The hotel had excellent location: few minutes walk from Paddington station. The underground was the best way to travel endeed. With underground it was easy to go everywhere in London. The hotel was clean and cosy because the rooms were cleaned every day. Bathroom was a surprise, but in a god way, it was also very clean. There weren´t any noice which could have distracted sleeping. Unfortunately iron was missing. The staff was amazing: friendly and awake 24 hours a day, so we could leave our hotel keys to the reception while being outside. They also borrowed us adapter and key for safety box. All in all we enjoyed staying very much and promised to return there next time we´ll visit London, which we´ll definitely do. -3 Girls from Finland

Reviews.Title: “Staff members need to go on a Customer Services training course”
Reviews.Author: AlexandrinaVicinOz
Reviews.Content: We booked two single rooms which were in the basement. They were hot and noisy. Decor in the rooms was tired and shabby. Staff could do with more customer service training. The breakfast routine was confusing and not explained properly. Electrical equipment in the bedrooms did not work properly. I would never go back again.

Reviews.Title: “basic”
Reviews.Author: Tanja51
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpfull. Depsite the sign that one could not leave one's luggage after checking out, we could leave oude luggage for the rest of the day over there. Ask for a room on the backside of the hotel. At the frontside is to noisy: buses, cars etc pass by, and you can hear it all. The photo's at the website of the rooms are from different hotel. Rooms are basic. There's no elevator, and we had a room on the third floor, but it was alright for us. Compare to the price and the central location it was alright

Reviews.Title: “Gresham Hotel excellent position”
Reviews.Author: larasophie
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from London, I was there with my students, and as in the past, I have seen that the comments made by travelers are the really important and can help you to have an idea of the place you are going to. As many other said, the hotel is not very cleaned and when we arrived we didn't find the rooms we had booked, but the staff was really kind and they helped us to find the best solution. So when I go to London, I am sure, I will go there again, because the location is perfect and even if you are not served breakfast, you can have it wherever you want, and above all in a few minutes you can reach every part of London. Bye-bey Cristina

Reviews.Title: “One of the best stay i had in long time”
Reviews.Author: Sabaa1914
Reviews.Content: To start with it is very close from Paddington station, hardly 5 min away. We were bit early to check in but no problem as the room was ready. Room was bit small but i must say it was extreamly cleane and it had a nice feel. Shower Toilet was as cleane as new, i was impressed. The Staff was very much helpful and friendly. They gave us very good diractions around the city and a maps as well. We felt like they were always very eger to help even at 2 o clock at night. Next day we met the hotel manager who was as friendly as the staff. In the evening the 24 hr bar was the right place to unwind as the other friendly guests of the hotel were there to give us the company. Overall very nice pleasent and peaceful stay, I would not think twice to book this hotel on my next trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but soooo noisy at night! you can really hear the city!”
Reviews.Author: Jack_mj
Reviews.Content: the hote was ok, old a creeky and the staff where nice enough but the rooms are very small and the hotel is soooo noisy at night I got about 40 mins sleep the 1 night we stayed.Single glazed windows just lets all the noise in. would not class it as a 3 start either!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but good value”
Reviews.Author: england1001
Reviews.Content: - Very good location, 5 min walk from Paddington station and everyone around the area helped us with directions to hotel. - Rooms very basic, we didnt have a window but litrally only used the hotel to sleep so was not bothered. They were clean though and that's all that really mattered! TV didnt work but probably could have been sorted out with reception but we didnt bother asking as it did not matter. - Reception were helpful, we were able to leave our bags behind there all day which was very good. - Small bar, didnt use but looked average. Pubs across the road and shops nearby. - Overall a very good stay for a very cheap price. Only bad thing was that people turned up at the hotel early hours of the morning and woke us up. We are only 18 so I can see where they are coming from but the walls in the hotel are really thin so it wasn't good. They also set off the fire alarm twice which was very annoying. It just depends what type of people are in the hotel when you stay I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - No way 3 star!!”
Reviews.Author: Millsy82
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for myself and a friend, as always looked ok on the website. However, this can no way be described as a 3 star hotel, it is 1 star at best! I have stayed in more luxurious hostels when backpacking! The lift was broken, the carpet on the stairs and communal areas was filthy and covered in stains, the carpet in the room looked like a patchwork quilt made up from different cuts overlapping each other. The room itself was box-like and the bathroom you could barely turn around in. The bedding was simply awful with just a sheet and a rough, itchy blanket, a bit like one you'd give to your dog. Plus anyone walking up the stairs sounded like they were coming through the roof! Not a good place.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient, basic hotel ideal for our stay in London”
Reviews.Author: DonegalFizzy
Reviews.Content: The area is great, only a couple of minutes from the train station, nice pubs and restaurants in the immediate vicinity. The hotel itself was basic the rooms were small but perfectly functional. The heating system was excellent. We found the staff friendly and helpful. There was a mishap with the taxi booked by reception to take us to kings cross but it worked out ok and the receptionist was very apologetic. We didnt try the food either for breakfast, lunch or dinner so we cant comment. The small bar looked very nice but we did not use it. The rooms were clean and the domestic staff very helpful. The carpets on the stairs looked a bit off putting an unfortunate colour for busy stairs. The lift was not working and there was no sign of getting it repaired a bit of a hike for some people to the third and fourth floors.. We would definately stay there again the next time we visit london

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: RegularTraveller17
Reviews.Content: On of many similar hotels on Sussex Gardens, the Gresham has a very helpful desk attendant that sets the tone for the stay. Lots of young holiday visitors who seemed happy with the place - nice atmosphere about the small reception area -thanks again to the helpful and pleasant desk attendant. Rooms are basic but have all the necessary items for a short stay where you will not spend much time in the hotel. Only problem is rooms to the front get a lot of noise from the street outside - could do with some double glazing or soundproofing. Short walk from Paddington station and walking distance to Edgware Road and Oxford Street.

Reviews.Title: “We would highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: MammyBlues
Reviews.Content: We stayed 9 days over Xmas 2009 in the Gresham in Sussex Gardens. We really enjoyed this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is kept very clean. It has a nice atmosphere. It has very good heating for the cold winter months. The location is perfect. Near Paddington Station, the underground and bus stops. It is a short walk to Hyde Park and Oxford Street. The road is quiet and has little traffic. We intend to use the Gresham on our future trips to London.

Reviews.Title: “small, old fashioned, but cheap charming and ideally located”
Reviews.Author: Miss_EOR
Reviews.Content: i stayed here in november for a short shopping and recreation trip. like most hotels in london the gresham is ideally located minutes from the tube station. the hotel is attractive and brightly lit from the outside, with many little restaurants and bars located right outside. the staff in reception are very friendly and helpful, giving us a map and marking off all tourist areas before we left for siteseeing. however you have to leave your key in reception when going out, in an open shelf located right at the front door. the elevator was very very slow and old so we took the stairs to our room, the hallways are narrow and its like a maze trying to find our room on the fourth floor. our room was teeny tiny, it was like if one person wanted to stand up or get to the other side of the room the other person had to stay on the bed with their feet up. bathroom was also tiny, again one person at a time. the walls were paper tin and laughing and talking could be heard all night, the cleaning staff were louder than necessary shouting at each other early in the morning so a lie in is probably impossible, also early one morning cleaning staff pounded down my door waking me up, despite the do not disturb sign on the door. we couldnt find the breakfast room the next morning in the maze of hallways upstairs, and the bar is this tiny area with two seats at the bar and two on a tiny couch adjacent to the bar. when leaving the hotel we were told we could leave our bags and come back later, which we were very happy about considering we had more siteseeing to do before our flight, however to our dismay the baggage area was a small hallway inside the entrance door that was not being monitored by staff, not very safe at all, so we ended up dragging our baggage around london for the day. However it was clean, cheap, and somehow had a charming feel, you get what you pay for, the friendly staff and ideal location are what saves this hotel

Reviews.Title: “My girlfriend was not impressed of my choice.”
Reviews.Author: Haraldsenb
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and me stayed here for 4 days. I don`t know how many hotels there are in the "hotel street" in Sussex Gardens, but i felt like i chosen the "wrong one" I spent time in various hotels in London before, so i didnt have much expectation about this hotel either. But this was by far the smallest room (room 235) i ever stayed in. It must have been a storageroom back in the days because i think the boiler room was under our bed. Even with the window wide open, no air did enter our room. Combined with the heat it was hard to get a good night sleep. I also think the elevator was working by man labour, it took ages before something happend so we took the stairs. This was probably a nice hotel in the 70`s. But the room was clean and the staff was friendly. The location was also why we chose this hotel. My girlfriend was not impressed of my choice. I think i will try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: Tinker85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gresham for one night on a business trip, for this purpose it is fine but I wouldn't recommend it for any longer. I had asked for a double room but I got a cramped family room, which although clean could have been so much better. The bathroom was small but adequate and clean. There was no mini bar in the room and it had a simple roller blind covering the window, a thin blanket on the bed and although there was a quilt in the wardrobe it had no cover. Also the bedside lights did not work. I also had problems with my room key (that was sellotaped together) and when I went to reception I was told to try again before they would do anything, generally not very helpful. Breakfast was good and the location is great, a two minute walk to Paddington station but I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A clean and friendly hotel that is ideally located”
Reviews.Author: infomiss
Reviews.Content: Travelled from Texas with family on a trip to Europe in September 2009. Arrived in London and staff were friendly and helped direct us to the hotel over the phone when we got lost. In the end the hotel was 400 metres from paddington station. We arrived and the friendly young man at the desk checked us in and took us to our rooms which were cosy and both had ensuite bathrooms (I have a big family). Whenever we went out the staff members would advise us where to go for shopping and once even printed out google maps and directions when were looking for Harrods and I got confused. I have stayed in hotels around the world where the hotels were big names but I didn't get a service as friendly and helpful as this. I highly recommend the Gresham Hotel to any of my fellow travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Would never go there again, even if offered for free!”
Reviews.Author: xDOTCOMx
Reviews.Content: First time going to London we looked for a hotel with good location and good price. What you get is exactly what you pay for. We stayed there for three nights. The rooms are very small and old. The shower had almost no pressure and the bathroom was covered in white goo from the shower head to the bathroom sink. The toilet didn't even flush properly. The beds were not comfortable at all. I've slept better on floors. There were some kind of bugs in this room because when we left and got back home to Iceland we noticed that we had been bitten all over our body. We had to disinfect all our clothing, the suitcases and our apartment when we got home. The maintenance were really loud and you can easily hear people talk in the next room. Overall I would never recomment this hotel to anyone. The hotel staff in the lobby was friendly though but that doesn't make up for everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: Roosee
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my husband and two kids age 8 and 12. We stayed in a family room and the room number was 250. The room was clean, big and with microwave and a small fridge. We stayed for 5 days and the hotel is very central too. Only thing that it should have four single beds instead of two double beds. The receptionist told us that they have a family room like that, but it was not available. London is great city and if we come here again, we will be staying at Gresham.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: peterodl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gresham for one night after arriving at Paddington station from Penzance before traveling onto Munich on June 7th, 2009 and was given room #215. It's a room that the phrase "Not big enough to swing a cat in" is apt. The room I booked was a single and it was just large enough to accomodate me without feeling claustrophobic but every time I came into the room, there was a distinctly odd musty smell. The room was right above the front door and I had some difficulty getting the window to slide down and shut once I opened it. The shower was fine as was the bed though the mattress could be replaced with something a bit firmer. The television remote's back cover was missing and the batteries held in place by scotch tape which did not add to the charm. The room was fine for my one night stay. The area of Paddington it is in is basically a hotel row. If you don't like your room, just walk next door and see what they have to offer. But the closeness to Paddington station and Hyde Park and the relative quiet of the street somewhat balences out the cramped room I had.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be Better”
Reviews.Author: Onthefeet
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week and liked it very much. Its clean, peaceful and friendly. If its your first time in London, then you must go there. Staff would help you a lot in getting your way around, plus WiFi and maps are free. Hyde park and Oxford Street are near by and there is very nice cafe to eat called Lena's Cafe. Hotel does provide tea/coffee facilities and Biscuits inside the room. Breakfast was not included in our room rent and we did not take it, but there are plenty of places to eat near by. Walk to Notting Hill is highly recommended among the neo-classical buildings and London sightseeing buses are five minutes from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Paddington area of London”
Reviews.Author: Fear0fFlying
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend in January for 2 nights. It is just around the corner from Paddington tube station so we were able to get around London and find our way back very easily and cheaply too. The room was basic but it had a nice feel to it, and the street it is on reminds you of something out of Oliver Twist. The bed was comfortable and the shower was powerful. There is a small bar/lounge area near the front of the hotel where we enjoyed a few bottles of red wine in the evening. The staff were ok, not exactly friendly, and we had an issue with one particular gentleman who worked one evening who was completely rude and dismissive of us. But that can be ignored..... Overall cheap price approx £45 a night, in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “All things considered, it wasn´t too bad or too good”
Reviews.Author: XchocolateX
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the hotel, I was told that I had to pay for my 3 night stay in advance and that if I wished to use a credit card there would be an extra charge. This was a good idea on their part, because few guests would stay a second night; at least those whose rooms faced the street. The delivery truck traffic started at 04:30; absolutely unbearable! My room was tiny, but clean and had been recently renovated, as had the entire hotel. Although the hotel´s website stated that the rooms had mini bars, they apparently had been removed, when the bar was open off the lobby and the website info had not been updated (on purpose??). The hotel is located very close to Paddington Station , lots of restaurants and local shopping, and close to Oxford St.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Izzowizzo
Reviews.Content: Rooms are crampy and small rooms, curtains not fixed properly, carpet not properly glued, nosy maintainance staff, had to be transferred 4times coz rooms were justso unpleasant. If it wasnt only a prebooked stay, I would be most willingful to transfer to another hotel. Wondering if they train their housekeeping that they should clean the rooms everyday and not wait til a guest complains. Its just near to Oxford and a bus stop away to NottingHill and other interesting places but the service and hotel TOTALLY SUCKS! Never want to go back here... EVER!!!!! Horrible experience really.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fair accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: the_man11111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gresham Hotel in London for a few days this past June. The Gresham is easily accessible from Paddington Station, which is nice since Paddington Station has an underground connection as well as a direct train to Heathrow for easy traveling. The hotel staff was nice, and the room faced the front road, which is a nice quiet, tree-lined blvd. The one thing that got me was that our toilet took a long time to refill, which means you had to wait nearly 30 minutes between flushing. This can be difficult among two people. Aside from that, the hotel itself was was nice. Its by no means a luxury hotel, but it wasn't a dirt-hole either. The road this hotel is located on though is littered with hotels. Looking back, I would rather walk down this street without a reservation, and try to play the hotels off each other in terms of prices.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasent”
Reviews.Author: JackofBerlin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a whole week and it is clean, friendly and on good location. Plus its a lot cheaper for same standard hotels. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Mink hole!! Would not even let my dog stay there!!”
Reviews.Author: babeeeeee
Reviews.Content: Well arrived after a long mornin, no place to leave suitcases in a safe place, and when we realised the flight of stairs to the room we could not believe it no lift. Going up the stairs to the room was dirty!! Finally we arrived to our room and disbelieve appeared on our faces, room was mingin!!Nothing cleaned and i dont even think the sheets wereclean. The pictures on the internet are not of the hotel thats for sure, good luck if your going to stay there, take bleach,clean sheets,a duster and towels with you. The only good thing about staying there is we managed to cram so much into our visit to london because we could not bare to stay in the room for longer than we had too.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Francesca072
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay in London was delightful, and we have to give credit to the Gresham Hotel for adding to it. Since our arrival up to our departure the staff was courteous and very helpful, our room and bath, though tiny, were quite clean and sunny, and the location was superb, one or two blocks away from several subway lines and many buses to different sections of the very center of the city. All in all, a delightful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rod & Vicky
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny but it was a great value and only two blocks from Paddington station so all of London was very accessible. Breakfast was great and reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Awful visit!”
Reviews.Author: Nixijay
Reviews.Content: we arrived to clock in at 3pm, and were sent to a tiny room at the back of the building, the room was so small that my partner of 6ft5 could touch both sides of the room!!! It was stupidly hot and we had to have the window open all night, which not only did not help with the heat but also caused furthur problems as the building opposite was a very rough looking appartment/flat building where one resident was playing extreamly loud music all night. To make our stay even worse there were a group of youths smoking drugs on a lower floor balcony (not of the hotel building) not far from our window. The room itself had a single headboard attacted to the wall but a very small queensize bed, proving that the room was designed as a single room but they have used it for 2 people which is disgraceful! There was also a wet patch by the bathroom door where the shower had obviously leaked, the toilet didn't flush properly and the shower itself was so small that it was a struggle to shut the cubicle door once you were in the shower! The stay was terrible and i would not advise anyone to book into this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice budget hotel,great location”
Reviews.Author: ilikeithot07
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked ourselves a room at the Gresham Hotel, London from the 15th-17th April because we had booked to see Grease in the West End. The hotel was easy to find as Sussex Gardens is simply a long row of hotels. The Gresham is easy to find at night especially as it has blue fairy lights over the front door - very pretty. We shared a double room which was very small - just big enough for a double bed - not much else. The decor was very nice - it looked like it had been recently done up and the bathroom was lovely. One small jibe about the bathroom was that the sink didnt have cold water - only boiling hot water so brushing our teeth wasnt so pleasant. The staff were lovely and very helpful. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lost my reservation and refused to make it right”
Reviews.Author: MobileMe
Reviews.Content: I'd called twice from South Africa to book this hotel. I'd negotiated a good rate and had a confirmation number. When I arrived at the Gresham after my all-night flight from Johannesburg, they did not have a record of the reservation and refused to take responsibility for their error or make it right. Their customer service is nonexistent.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value, nice experience”
Reviews.Author: theblackpoodle
Reviews.Content: We changed our reservation to The Gresham, after reading bad reviews about our original choice. We arrived a bit early, but we were checked in with no fuss, by a friendly guy at reception. Our first floor room was fairly small, but was very modern and clean, with a good sized bed and flat screen tv. Our 2 night stay was perfect for us. The hotel is within walking distance of Oxford St and the Hyde Park area. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coooolsach
Reviews.Content: A nice budget hotel, specially after reading reviews on trip advisor i knew i was taking a gamble but it's paid off. A very friendly service, nice clean rooms bit small though and what a fantastic location. just want to tell other travellers that ofcoure this is not a hotel for you if you are expacting a 5* service in a price of 3*. You get what you pay for and here you surely get a bit more such as smiling and very helpful front desk staff!!!! So over all not a bad hotel at all givan that your expactations are not too high. i would surely don't mind to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: Heather21788
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gresham Hotel in November 2008 and although it was somewhat decent, would NOT recommend to travelers. Very small room along with a VERY tiny shower - almost couldn't move. The beds were hard as a rock and had holes in the sheets. Besides the small room, the entire hotel was just run in a very unprofessional manner. You have to leave your key at the front desk whenever you leave the hotel. First day there they lose our key, then break their master key in our room trying to open it. Their "bar" did not include any liquor or a bartender. Before checking in, you have to store your luggage in the hall next to a sign that reads "not responsible for stolen luggage." Breakfast was decent, and the hotel is in a nice area close to Paddington Station. Location aside however, I would not recommend the Gresham Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would not go back”
Reviews.Author: PendOreille
Reviews.Content: The room was small, dirty and noisy with window to a shaft so almost no light. TV required that you stand on top of bed to turn on and off and change channels--no remotes. Room was very dirty with dirt under bed, drawers filled with trash. Bathroom was small, but clean. Front desk staff were nice, but I had them call a taxi for us. The one they had sent --charged me the same rate for a ten minute walk (we had two heavy bags), as the one that had brought us across a town the day before. I would never go back or recommend. There are many hotels in the area. I walked around the area, and ended up staying in the Best Western The Delmere which gave me a better price and CLEAN room after I used my prebooked nights at The Gresham.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small”
Reviews.Author: GarySDenver
Reviews.Content: Room was very small but clean. Bathroom nearly as big as the room. Almost no storage. Toilet flush handle was broken. Dresser drawers were broken. English was not the first language of the desk staff. Asked about a local restaurant that I had found on the internet and was directed to go to Soho so I assume the staff has no knowlege of the local area. I believe I could have gotten a better value for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GaborHungary
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over the last week and had a wonderful experience. Excellent location and friendly staff. The hotel is on a busy street though, first we had room on ground floor which we requested to change due to fear of noise and they given us a very nice room on back side in 2nd floor. There was free Wi-fi and london maps. Breakfast was not included in our price and we only had taken it on our last day. Overall it was pleasent.

Reviews.Title: “Creaky Floors & Banging Doors....NEXT !”
Reviews.Author: chris036
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately West London is full of shining examples such as the Gresham Hotel; overused establishments that receive little attention or housework or, more importantly, pay attention to reviews. From the outside the terraces along Sussex Gardens are gorgeous. But once you part with your money from the tidy reception area and step into the lift, it's a different place entirely - and not one you'll rate amongst the better hotels on your travels. I had a single room on the 2nd floor, which was just big enough for the bed, fittings and furniture was tired and very worn out...the floor creaked...the doors closed like thunder...the cold tap was hot...the hot tap was hotter. Need I continue? I didn't stick around to try the included Breakfast. Well, after a night itching and shuffling in the tired out bed who would. Somehow doubt I'll be back in a hurry!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: KooksPE
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms a double and a triple. Both were TINY little holes with windows facing into courtyards. The hotel was so noisy at night that we had to use earplugs .Staff expected us to pay CASH upfront and wanted to charge an additional 15% to use Visa Card. The rooms were tiny (double bed pushed against wall so could only climb in one side) no bedside tables and the bathrooms were SHOCKING the filth was quite unbelievable. The beds were not made up properly on the second and third mornings I had to complain to get the beds made up (duvet cover used as sheet and a small blanket on double beds) The laminated floors were so dusty that anything that fell on the floor had to be dusted off! The breakfast room consisted of a basement room with a sheet covered screen separating the kitchen area and they wanted to charge £7 a head for the privilege There are at least 30 hotels in this street try another one instead!

Reviews.Title: “NICE STAY”
Reviews.Author: arses
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasant stay and I really enjoyed it. Hotel was good and the price was also worth it. I do have business trips to UK and I enjoy staying here after one stay. The rooms are nice and the breakfast was fabulous!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach”
Reviews.Author: rover05
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at this hotel we were given the keys two our rooms, (203 and 204) Room 204 was spacious and appeared to be in a realtively clean state, however room 203 was no bigger than a shoe box but appeared realtivelyy clean. We did not spend a great deal of time in the hotel only to have a shower and get ready for an evening at the theatre. Upon our return from the theatre we entered room 203 and switched on the lights to see a Cockroach run across the floor, under the bed. We called for the receptionist who was unable to catch it. We lifted the beds to find an array of rubbish and dirt, which inevitably left us unsurprised at finding a cockroach. As it was 1.30am we had no other option than to stay in the hotel until the morning, therefore having a restless nights sleep in the same room. I have recently been in contact with the manager regarding this issue and have been told that there can be no refund or discount returned to us as we stayed in the room. There was no other option to this due to the time of the incident. I have written to the hotels directors who have not had the courtesy to reply and am yet to get any kind of written apology for the incident. There are many hotels in London offereing accomoadtion of a much higher standard for a very similar price and I would recommend you stay well away from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved the stay”
Reviews.Author: habuTexas
Reviews.Content: It is a nice hotel in a good location near to the city attractions. The rooms were small but were manageable and all it matters was I enjoyed my 2 night stay as the staff was friendly and the environment was good.

Reviews.Title: “'Oh What a night!'”
Reviews.Author: StephenMiltonKeynes
Reviews.Content: Where do you start? Stopped off here with my family to spend a night at a theatre, meal and not have to have that late night trug to go back home. Mucked up our booking from the first moment we walked in. Asked for a twin and double - got? 3 singles and a double all on different floor. Receptionist and her side kick, were helpful but completely unfeeling at any stage. The sort of attuitude you would recieve from a hotel in the back streets of Cairo. But in my capital city? (NO disrespect to Cairo!) Single rooms? Prisoners have more space and better equipped cells then these rooms. Television reception lousy. Walls dirty. Bathroom very worn out, scaled shower head etc. The sheets WERE clean though. Bar? Asked for a water. Don't sell any. Had orange juice they only had one glass. No management evident at any time during our stay. Fire door in the bar locked. Breakfast? Don't bother. Disorganised, uncaring, mayhem at it's best. We walked in - and walked out! This place was very busy however with tourists, obvioulsy booked on line and stuck in a situation where they had paid and could not opt out - if they tried I'm sure the receptionist wouldn't know what to do anyway. Went out for a walk up to the traffic lights and spotted a sign from the Met Police ''Be aware - 39 prostitutes have been arrested in this area - 37 have been cautioned etc' If you haven't guessed - don't bother - because the owners obviously don't!

Reviews.Title: “Next time your passing... keep going!”
Reviews.Author: thenaghis
Reviews.Content: Had booked two rooms, arrived and only one was reserved... this is only the beginning! Tiny, poor quality bedrooms- definately not clean. Three of us (2 adults 1 child) had to each have a seperate room because they had made a mistake with our booking. Not ideal to have your child in a seperate room on a different floor! We walked in and out of breakfast... it was like feeding time at the zoo! The tables were filthy, there was tea and coffee over the floor and there was nowhere for us to sit! Don't get in the lift... i did and as soon as i stepped in, it dropped about a foot so i quickly jumped back out and walked the four flights of stairs to my cupboard (my room!) Bar... what a joke! We asked for two drinks of water and they only had one glass! (no sparkling water available) The whole place smelt of stale cigarettes, three tonnes of dirty washing were abandoned at the bottom of the stairs and the fire exits were padlocked!! All in all... the best part of our stay, was leaving!

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: lilan66
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for one night. the location was great if you want to get out and about london. It is close to paddington station so anywhere on the tube network is easy to get to.I agree that rooms are bit small but they are very clean and comfortable. Ours was at the back so no traffic noise. breakfast was good staffs were friendly too. I would stay here again and i think it was good value and the location was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “This may have been the worst hotel that we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: silvrboxtr
Reviews.Content: We made our reservation 6 months in advance, checked in shortly after noon and got a really bad 15X18 room; twin beds head to head with treadbare carpet that they wouldn''t dare vacuum, hole in the wall and finally the curtain coming down. The steam heating knob was missing and one had to keep the window open all night with noise drifting up from below. We asked for another ,but they insisted that this was the only one available. This, on the fourth floor, no lift, toilet and shower down the hall for $110 a night. So be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Basic & Really Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Helen008
Reviews.Content: We paid £70 per room and booked two rooms for one night. The rooms were very very small and had we been there any longer than one night I would not have been very happy. The bathroom was minute and freezing cold and the toilet didn't flush properly. The whole room was very dated, however the beds were clean and very comfortable. The breakfast was adequate, very pleasant staff who were eager to please. We were told when we arrived that we could park our car there for £10 for the night, when I asked if we could leave it until about four the following day I was told no as they would charge an extra £10!! for anything after 11am!! as we were checking in I said I would come back and let them know what I wanted to do with regards to the car, as we were thinking of taking it to a car park. I was told in no uncertain terms that if I wanted the parking space I needed to pay for it right now!! No receipt was given!!! I wonder if this is just a perk for the staff? All in all a very below average hotel not worth the money at all but hey this is London and it seems that you get what you pay for (whether we like it or not)

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel ever....!!!”
Reviews.Author: doctoreuro
Reviews.Content: Filthy rooms, Broken toilet seat (which was not fixed for 2 days despite being promised), White members of staff only friendly to white customers, Cramped T-I-N-Y rooms, This hotel is a rip off.. DO NOT STAY HERE..

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MalcNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in this hotel, staff were friendly but did have great command english language. The room we were in was tiny, I know the room was cheap but you could not fully open the bathroom door for the bed! Room was on the ground floor and had no external windows or air conditioning it was hot. If your hard up stay here but itwas still £80 plus ofr this room.

Reviews.Title: “it is not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: guncheto
Reviews.Content: We first were tgoing to stay in the Bickenhall Hotel in Gloucester Place but they call us the same day tha we were going to arrive in London to tell us that the hotel was full so they had to send us to Gresham Hotel . When i saw the room i thought it was a joke but it wasnt . Very small room , very small shower room and that it's. Dirty carpet and they didnt change sheets while we were there for 4 nights. The staff its vwery kindly and they serve breakfast .

Reviews.Title: “Accounting nightmare And a dirty bed spread!”
Reviews.Author: Midlandsallzones
Reviews.Content: I booked in February and on arrival on April 21-22nd, there was no imformation on the computer system for our second room, Thanks God I bought along copies. Still don't know if I was charged even though I offered to pay in cash, it was refused and was told to pay at check out which they atill refused. My bedspread was very stained, even though the colour was brown the stains were quite visable. The lock on my window was broken, as I was downstairs any one could have gotten in. Was not allowed a spare key even though there was 4 of us. We had a hard time with one ot the locks. The trolley with cleaning materials and towels etc. stayed outside my room 256 all night. My pals stayed in room 208 and there was not even a number on the door. Because the door had two glass panes, one friend could not sleep all night due to the light shining in his eyes all night. They would not let me have a late check out, but let me store my bag in the bar area unlocked and unattended.

Reviews.Title: “Will be using this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: Somersetyid
Reviews.Content: Firstly i will say, although i agree with some of the comments made about the hotel, like the shower head being in need of de-scaling and the blinds not being able to roll up, i have to say that my room was clean enough. Also i think that most people using a hotel of this style only need somewhere to get their heads down at night, not somewhere to stay for hours on end, i couldnt wait to get out and hit London. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and as far as i saw they could all speak very good English!! I will certainly be using this hotel again when staying in London.

Reviews.Title: “definately not a 3 star, filthy room,dirty bedspread.”
Reviews.Author: ourjude
Reviews.Content: booked this as the photos of it looked nice, and also it stated 3 stars, my first time in a london hotel as we went to a west end show, we arrived around 2pm, the receptionist seemed friendly enough, we proceeded to our room small was ok, but filthy carpet, dirty shower head and definately not a fresh bedspread was not our idea of 3 stars for this hotel,i think 1 star would be going over the top.

Reviews.Title: “One to avoid”
Reviews.Author: lcleaver1979
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel I ever stayed in. We had two rooms and. 1.The floor carpet in room 249 had shards of glass embedded in it. 2.The blind in room 249 would not raise. 3.Rooms 249 and 238 smelt like an open sewer. 4.Room 238 had open electrics over the bed (see two photographs attached) 5.Room 238 had a cracked window. 6.In room 238 the top fell off the bed and left splinters on the pillow (see photos) 7.The wardrobe in room 238 had a rusty screw instead of a handle (see photos) 8.The sink in room 238 had no plug, just a 6” hole (see photos) 9.The showerhead in room 238 was caked in limescale and mostly blocked (see photos) 10.The glass shower screen in room 238 had no bracket and so fell into the shower and flooded the bathroom (see photos) 11.The extractor in the ceiling in room 238 was covered in something that looked like moss (see photos) 12.The extractor fan in room 249 did not make regulatory guidelines. 13.The toilet roll in room 238 wasn’t new and it had wet hand inprints in it (see photos)

Reviews.Title: “My room was full of insects”
Reviews.Author: Tellte
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this place a few times and it has got more rundown each time. I kept comming back as I got a good deal and the location is good. However, I will never go back since my last visit. During the day all was okay but at night - very late at night - all these insects would crawl out from under the bathroom floor and go round the bathroom and unto the bedroom carpet also. I killed loads of them and reception said that other guests had complained too!! They refused to refund any money so that is the end of my dealings with them.

Reviews.Title: “smiling people”
Reviews.Author: palazzogiallo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gresham Hotel in June 2006 for four days, I found the staff friendly and helpful. They have a bar so that was handy, the rooms were a little on the small size, but clean and tidy with an ensuite bathroom. It ' s a good value hotel for a short stay in central London. Mick, dublin

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and dangerous”
Reviews.Author: Kishmul
Reviews.Content: We were attracted to this hotel by location, the 3* rating, the statement, that families were welcome and that the hotel had been refurbished. We found that only the location matched expectations. On arrival the receptionist was unfriendly, and couldn't find our bookings (our party had multiple rooms booked). In the end we got our rooms. And then we then found a lot more to be troubled by: - the lift was dirty, and did not always work - carpets were dirty and there were various unpleasant odours in different areas of the hotel - laundry bags were left lining / blocking corridors - doors which opened directly over the top of narrow staircases, with no warning sign - room windows which did not lock - TVs which had virtually no reception - dirty bath, with hair in it - no plug on sink (our request for this to be remedied was ignored) - worn out soft furnishings - shower that leaked onto floor - another shower with no temperature control (only very hot) Concerned about cleanliness, security and accident risk (particularly for the kids) we cut short our stay and left. The receptionist did not seem surprised, and promised the manager would contact us. We've heard nothing. We found another hotel in London ( a genuine 3* - clean and friendly ) and enjoyed the rest of our holiday.

HotelInfo.Name: Gresham Hotel London
HotelInfo.Address: 116 Sussex Gardens | Hyde Park, London W2 1UA, England
